sentences.en: A wrongdoer is constantly haunted by the fear of discovery.
sentences.cn: 作恶者经常心中害怕被发觉.

sentences.en: Charles is haunted by ghostly children.
sentences.cn: 孩子们的幽灵缠上了查尔斯。

sentences.en: He haunted textile mills, and learned all he could.
sentences.cn: 他常到纺织厂去, 尽可能多学点东西.

sentences.en: He was a Vietnam veteran with a haunted mien.
sentences.cn: 他是个越战老兵,举止总有些惶然.

sentences.en: He would always be haunted by that scene in Well Park.
sentences.cn: 他永远无法摆脱威尔公园里的那一幕。

sentences.en: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
sentences.cn: 父母过于爱面子的做法在他儿时一直困扰着他。

sentences.en: She looked so haunted, I almost didn't recognize her.
sentences.cn: 她愁容满面，我差点儿没认出她来。

sentences.en: The country is haunted by the spectre of civil war.
sentences.cn: 内战仿佛一触即发，举国上下一片恐慌。

sentences.en: The England skipper is haunted by a run of low scores.
sentences.cn: 英格兰队的队长得了一连串的低分。

sentences.en: The forest was dark and silent, haunted by shadows and unseen presences.
sentences.cn: 这个森林黑暗寂静，经常有幽灵和看不见的鬼怪出没。

sentences.en: The insanity which ran in his family haunted him.
sentences.cn: 家族遗传的精神错乱困扰着他。

sentences.en: The village is haunted by the ghosts of the dead children.
sentences.cn: 死去的孩子们的幽灵常在该村出没。

sentences.en: There was a haunted look in his eyes.
sentences.cn: 他眼中透露出忧虑的神色。

sentences.en: Tracy said the cabin was haunted.

words.tran_cn: 不易忘怀的，萦绕于心头的；给人以强烈感受的
常去；缠住某人；萦绕在…心中（haunt的ing形式）
常出没于…；萦绕于…；经常去…

trans.tran_en: a haunted building is believed to be visited regularly by the soul of a dead person
